image.altText: Jason Sourasis and Scott Pendlebury.

props.synopsis: Former Magpies skipper Scott Pendlebury has hired one of Australia's most high-profile commercial lawyers to claim millions that he alleges his former confidant misappropriated.

title.children: How a billion-dollar dream blew up a friendship with an AFL star

image.altText: A police car and an ambulance parked near a pier in the dark.

props.synopsis: The search for a man missing in waters near Mornington has resumed after the boat he was in capsized late on Friday night.

title.children: Man missing after boat capsizes off Melbourne's Port Phillip Bay

image.altText: Rebecca in a cave wearing a helmet and holding dynamite

props.synopsis: The mining industry is notoriously "bloke-centred". Rebecca Norton transitioned gender and kept going.

title.children: 50 years ago, a transgender mining engineer broke the glass ceiling

image.altText: An underwater scene, showing sea urchins sitting on coral and algae species.

props.synopsis: A hidden environmental crisis lurks beneath the crystal clear waters of Australia's east coast as long-spined sea urchins wreak havoc on the coast. Now scientists are trialling a new solution.

title.children: AI robots to stop sea urchins turning seabed into 'moonscape'

image.altText: A man in a suit outside of a court house.

props.synopsis: Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell is being provided with access to Mein Kampf — a political manifesto written by Nazi Party leader Adolf Hitler — as he prepares for a contested court hearing.

title.children: Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell granted access to Adolf Hitler manifesto

image.altText: A dark brown butterfly with yellow, blue and tan markings.

props.synopsis: Australia's photographic natural database is about to get a big boost as citizen scientists are urged to join a national search.

title.children: Bug Hunt calls on Australia's volunteer citizen scientists to join in

image.altText: Nick McKenzie wearing a blue suit and tie

props.synopsis: Victoria Police are investigating a burglary at the home of award-winning journalist Nick McKenzie.

title.children: Construction industry taskforce investigate burglary at journalist's home

image.altText: An illustration of someone sitting in front of a computer with an AI prompt

props.synopsis: Staff and a union say a generative AI model being tested in Australian Community Media's regional newspapers is misattributing facts and leaving some fearing for their jobs.

title.children: Regional newsroom staff say AI rollout leading to potential errors

image.altText: Elise Hodder poses during a photo shoot, looking across the camera and seen from side profile.

props.synopsis: Drunk driver Connor Mathiasson returned a blood alcohol reading more than four times the legal limit and had traces of cocaine and cannabis in his system when he killed Elise Hodder.

title.children: Elise Hodder's parents say model's future 'ripped away' after fatal crash

image.altText: A hand holds a mobile phone with the screen showing several social media apps

props.synopsis: Police did not know his name but they did have his Snapchat handle. From there, detectives pieced together a case that would reveal the true identity of sex offender 'Alec'.

title.children: The digital breadcrumb that led police to 'Alec', a child sex offender

image.altText: A bearded goalkeeper poised to make a save during a soccer game in front of a large crowd.

props.synopsis: Socceroos hero Andrew Redmayne sheds light on the stresses A-League players face after a report finds footballers are struggling with their mental health, substance abuse and job security issues.

title.children: 'Hell of a lot of stress': A-League mental health concerns revealed

image.altText: Man holding phone horizontally while wearing body camera on a property that looks like a farm with mountain in the background

props.synopsis: Mount Buffalo National Park will open to everyone as Victoria Police's search for Dezi Freeman continues with the creation of a new taskforce.

title.children: Freeman search continues as Mount Buffalo fully reopens to public

image.altText: Kim and Evelyn

props.synopsis: Cracked and uneven footpaths are more than an eyesore for Evelyn Henderson and Kim Hunt — they are hazardous barriers preventing them from getting where they need to go.

title.children: Frustration and falls as cash-strapped councils neglect footpaths

image.altText: A blue and white helicopter hovers in a grey sky above white capped waves, not far off shore.

props.synopsis: Police say two men who drowned on Wednesday were a British national who was surfing in extreme conditions and his friend who came to his aid.

title.children: British surfer and friend revealed as Frankston drowning victims

image.altText: A black and white photo of a teenage boy in a school uniform.

props.synopsis: The data is included in the findings into the death of 15-year-old Solomone Taufe'ulungaki, who died after being chased by a gang who thought he was a member of a rival group.

title.children: Coroner finds one in 14 fatal stabbing victims in Victoria are children

image.altText: Broadmeadows train station sign

props.synopsis: Two teenage boys were hospitalised with stab wounds after an alleged brawl between two groups armed with a screwdriver and possibly a machete at a train station in Broadmeadows on Wednesday.

title.children: Teens stabbed in alleged screwdriver, machete brawl in Melbourne's north

image.altText: A man is arrested by police and handcuffed

props.synopsis: Three men charged over a machete brawl outside Melbourne's Luna Park have been freed on bail, despite police urging magistrates to keep the trio locked up.

title.children: 'Grow up fast': Magistrates release men after Luna Park machete brawl

image.altText: A man with grey hair in a pink collared shirt stands in front of a brick building with umbrellas that says "Pellegrini's".

props.synopsis: Business owners say recent incidents — including a random daylight stabbing and clashes between protesters and police — are deterring customers from the heart of the Victorian capital.

title.children: Melbourne city traders call for more action amid spate of brazen crimes

image.altText: a female football player

props.synopsis: Carlton defender Harriet Cordner says sport has a key role to play in challenging gendered stereotypes in society, particularly given its reach within communities.

title.children: Taylor Swift, Bunny the dog and tackling gendered violence: Inside Carlton Respects

image.altText: A toddler sits facing away from the camera looking towards her toys in the loungeroom.

props.synopsis: Foster carers in Victoria say sudden allowance reductions for children with complex needs have left them feeling "undervalued and confused".

title.children: Foster carers 'blindsided' by alleged payment cuts amid government denials

image.altText: a large rock in the Wimmera overlooking vast plains of green and trees.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government clarifies rock climbing bans remain in place in the Grampians and other sites after a message spread online that the bans "were off".

title.children: Rock climbers' celebrations crushed as government confirms bans remain

image.altText: A hand holding a phone with the BOM website

props.synopsis: As wild weather wreaked havoc across the country, the Bureau of Meteorology launched a new website.

title.children: 'Not happy BOM': Agency's new website causes a storm

image.altText: A fire-damaged pub.

props.synopsis: It's not the first time the Lascelles Minapre pub on the Sunraysia Highway, south of Mildura, has been damaged by fire in its 119-year history.

title.children: Historic outback pub and meeting place burns down

image.altText: A shipping container mock up which says 'Energy Storage System'

props.synopsis: A proposed energy storage facility in Macedon could power thousands of homes — but not everyone is convinced it is being built in the right place.

title.children: Battery storage project planned for Victorian bushfire location

image.altText: A group of children skiing in the snow

props.synopsis: The managing body of Victoria's six alpine resorts says it is reviewing winter operations at its Mount Stirling resort, which has been "operating at a financial deficit" for some time.

title.children: Ski resort's future uncertain after 'many years' of financial losses

image.altText: A model with long dark curly hair, wearing a white head cap and a white dress

props.synopsis: Award-winning fashion designer Amy Lawrance blends 90s sci-fi with the medieval in her new collection, Total Recall.

title.children: Meet the Bendigo-born fashion designer blowing up in New York

image.altText: A black-and-white photo of horses and workers building a wall.

props.synopsis: The Glenmaggie Weir was built 100 years ago to supply water to sugar beet farmers, and now keeps local dairy farms going.

title.children: How Victoria's old sugar beet industry helped dairy farmers prosper

image.altText: A man smiles at a piano in Hamilton

props.synopsis: A country Victorian art gallery has surprised local artist Hamish Elsmann with an exhibition of work he never knew it was keeping. The community response has changed his life.

title.children: Gallery celebrates secret artist hidden in plain sight

image.altText: Brown paddock aerial photo with fence line

props.synopsis: The federal government grants major project status to a joint Australian-US mine in regional Victoria.

title.children: Controversial rare earth mine in Victorian town fast-tracked by government deal

image.altText: A middle-aged, grey-haired man in a police uniform stands in front of a Victroia Police backdrop.

props.synopsis: The chief commissioner of Victoria Police says the use of a police helicopter for a work trip to Tasmania "creates a poor impression".

title.children: Victoria's top cop sorry for using police chopper to fly to Tasmania

image.altText: A brown plush monster doll keychain hung on a brown bag.

props.synopsis: Police seize Labubu dolls found during a search at a property in Melbourne's west. The dolls, worth an estimated $9,000, were allegedly stolen from a CBD shopping centre.

title.children: Man arrested in Melbourne after police seize dozens of Labubu dolls

image.altText: A blue 'for lease' sign outside of a house.

props.synopsis: A survey of 1,000 Victorian renters finds nearly four in five households faced a tenancy issue over a 12-month period — but only half of them escalated the issue by lodging a complaint.

title.children: Fear of retaliation stops renters from raising issues, survey finds

image.altText: Protesters face off with police at a demonstration on a city street.

props.synopsis: Victoria's police minister has backed the police response to protests in Melbourne's CBD on Sunday, when demonstrators were hit with rubber bullets and pepper spray.

title.children: Police minister defends use of rubber bullets on Melbourne protesters

image.altText: Chris Scott and Bailey Smith during a Geelong pre-game

props.synopsis: Geelong and Victoria coach Chris Scott gets on the offensive about his star midfielder Bailey Smith while urging fans and pundits not to over-react when State of Origin returns next year.

title.children: Scott says Geelong's recruitment of Bailey Smith is an 'outrageous success'

image.altText: Jason Sourasis

props.synopsis: The former financial adviser to Collingwood star Scott Pendlebury has racked up a multi-million dollar tax debt since 2021.

title.children: Sports business mogul facing multi-million-dollar tax debt
